cvm_oct_dma_chunk_t Struct Reference

#include <cvm-oct-dev.h>

Detailed Description

Core: The PCI DMA uses instruction chunks to read the DMA instructions posted by the driver.

The chunks are a chained list of fixed-size buffers. This structure is used solely by the PCI core driver.

Definition at line 43 of file cvm-oct-dev.h.

Data Fields

uint32_t tag
uint32_t resvd_lock
cvmx_spinlock_t lock
 Lock to control access to this structure.
uint64_t * buf
 Address of the current instruction chunk.
uint32_t chunk_size
 Size of chunk in the PCI DMA instruction chunked list.
uint32_t current_word
 The current offset into the current chunk where the next DMA instruction word is written by host.
uint32_t total_free_words
 Total words that can be written in the chunk's free space.
uint32_t max_words
 Maximum words that can be written in this chunk.
uint64_t doorbell_reg
uint64_t extra_buf
 An extra buffer allocated so that chunks can be quickly chained.
uint32_t pool
 The pool from which the chunks are allocated by driver.

uint32_t cvm_oct_dma_chunk_t::max_words

Maximum words that can be written in this chunk.

max_words = (chunk_size / word_size(8 bytes)) - 1 (for next pointer).

Definition at line 68 of file cvm-oct-dev.h.

uint32_t cvm_oct_dma_chunk_t::pool

The pool from which the chunks are allocated by driver.

The Hardware frees them to the same pool.
